title.rendered: Vaughan Handyman: 4 Benefits of Installing a Freestanding Bathtub

content.rendered:
Freestanding tubs are classic and timeless; the sleek and open design makes the fixture a complement to every design style, from modern to traditional. Also, the tubs come in various styles and prices, meaning homeowners can find exactly what they are looking for, likely within budget, while planning bathroom renovations in Vaughan.

Benefits of Freestanding Tubs

From clawfoot to pedestal tubs, you are not limited to any particular style when selecting a freestanding option. Also, while most people are familiar with ceramic, porcelain, and fibreglass tubs, the fixtures come in many materials. Fibreglass options are the most affordable, with ceramic and porcelain coming in a close second.

However, if money is not a barrier, you can also choose from cast iron, stone, or copper. The materials are unique and will add flair to a bathroom design. Some of the more luxurious options are heavier than a typical tub, so you must ensure your house’s joist can support the added weight.

Regardless of the material and design you choose, freestanding tubs are versatile design options. Before you opt for a built-in design, consider the many benefits of a freestanding tub.

1. Gives the Illusion of More Space

People may not realize it, but a freestanding tub will take up more space than a built-in. That said, freestanding options give the illusion of more space because they allow the area around them to breathe. For example, a clawfoot tub allows the tile bathroom floors to flow unobstructed. The tile design extends underneath the tub and to the surrounding walls, giving the illusion of more floor space. Also, the walls of the tubs typically come with a slant, meaning you have a sightline to the vertical wall space around the tub. It’s pretty miraculous when you think about it.

2. Offers Many Colors and Designs To Choose From

From natural stone to porcelain and pedestals to clawfoot designs, you can find a freestanding bathtub to match your decor. Also, depending on the material, you can choose unique colours and patterns for the tub. For example, if working with a black-and-white design, you can opt for a solid black tub or one with a solid black outer shell and a pure white interior. You might even want something bolder, like red or yellow. Talk to a qualified professional to learn more about materials and design options.

3. Provides Flexibility in the Space

You can talk to a handyman in Vaughan about beneficial bathroom layouts, but a freestanding tub will provide the most design and layout flexibility. With a freestanding option, you can place the tub anywhere in the bathroom footprint. If you wanted, you could install the bathtub in the center of the room — reserve that option for large bathrooms because freestanding tubs are large.

4. Makes a Statement

While freestanding tubs are popular, most homeowners do not have them. Many people opt for built-ins because it is what they had when they moved in or it was the cheaper option. The funny thing is, freestanding tubs are the better investment because they can last an average of five years longer than a built-in when properly maintained. 

In addition to their longevity and design flexibility, freestanding tubs are statement pieces. It is difficult to walk into a professionally remodelled bathroom, see a beautiful freestanding tub, and not say, “wow.” They are beautiful and add to any bathroom design. 

Work With Experienced and Licensed Professionals

Before purchasing a freestanding bathtub, talk to a professional contractor. The tubs are large, and your bathroom will need adequate space for the tub to look right. Contact Handyman Connection in Vaughan to discuss freestanding tubs and consult a professional about your bathroom remodel.
